data.name: NorthLindseyCollege_20120223
data.value: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?> <catalog xmlns="http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog" xmlns:xcri="http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog/terms" xmlns:credit="http://purl.org/net/cm" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1" xmlns:mlo="http://purl.org/net/mlo" xmlns:x="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog http://www.xcri.co.uk/bindings/xcri_cap_1_2.xsd http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog/terms http://www.xcri.co.uk/bindings/xcri_cap_terms_1_2.xsd" generated="2012-02-14T10:30:06.75Z"> <description> Further and Higher Education courses offered by North Lindsey College in Scunthorpe. Updated weekly</description> <provider> <description> <x:div> <x:h1>Welcome to North Lindsey College</x:h1> <x:p>North Lindsey College is <x:span style="COLOR: rgb(212,0,80); FONT-WEIGHT: bold">outstanding</x:span> according to the Ofsted inspection of September 2010.</x:p> <x:p>We are the largest provider of post-16 education and training in North Lincolnshire, offering a huge range of full-time, part-time and apprenticeship courses at a range of levels. Our learners benefit from excellent facilities plus friendly and vocationally experienced staff.</x:p> <x:p>Whatever your needs, we have a course for you. Everyone is welcome.</x:p> <x:p>We are also an associate college of the University of Lincoln, and offer a range of HNCs, HNDs, degrees and an exciting new range of foundation degrees.</x:p> <x:p>In addition, since September 2008 we have been a smoke free College with smoking no longer permitted anywhere on the College campus.</x:p> </x:div> </description> <dc:identifier xsi:type='ukrlp:ukprn'>10004695</dc:identifier> <dc:title>North Lindsey College</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.northlindsey.ac.uk/</mlo:url> <mlo:location> <mlo:postcode>DN17 1AJ</mlo:postcode> <mlo:address xsi:type='addressLine'>North Lindsey College</mlo:address> <mlo:address xsi:type='addressLine'>Kingsway</mlo:address> <mlo:address xsi:type='addressLine'>Scunthorpe</mlo:address> <mlo:address xsi:type='addressLine'>North Lincolnshire</mlo:address> <mlo:phone>01724 281111</mlo:phone> <mlo:fax>01724 294020</mlo:fax> <mlo:email>info@northlindsey.ac.uk</mlo:email> <mlo:url>http://www.northlindsey.ac.uk/admin/page_edit.php?page_seq=16</mlo:url> <town>Scunthorpe</town> </mlo:location> <course> <description> <x:div> <x:p>If you love drawing, painting and making things and have an interest in creative studies such as art and design and want to develop your skills and self confidence, this course will be suitable for you. The course is mainly practical, learning how to produce a variety of creative images using drawing, painting and digital media, however evidence of written work is also required.</x:p> <x:p>This exciting one-year course focuses on a vocational pathway in Art and Design and Digital. It will introduce learners to a variety of drawing, painting, IT and craft skills used in the creative industry. Learners will have the opportunity to experiment with the techniques they have been taught and produce a range of art, design, digital media and craft work outcomes. Learners will also study 3 essential functional skills in English, Mathematics and IT to support progression to higher level courses. Where possible the functional skills will be embedded into the pathway options to enable learners to practise what they have been taught. Learners will also cover Personal and Social Development units to support the main programme and develop independent thinking</x:p> </x:div> </description> <dc:identifier>PF12001</dc:identifier> <dc:subject>creative arts</dc:subject> <dc:subject>drawing</dc:subject> <dc:subject>presenting</dc:subject> <dc:title>LEVEL 1 DIPLOMA IN ART, DESIGN & MEDIA</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.northlindsey.ac.uk/courses/PF12001</mlo:url> <abstract>This exciting one-year course focuses on a vocational pathway in Art, Design and Digital Media</abstract> <applicationprocedure>Instructions on how to apply</applicationprocedure> <assessment>Your progress will be measured through practical projects, written assignments, internal and external assessments. You will receive information about this through verbal feedback from your tutor, written feedback from an assignment or project and related grading of your work. Assessment of learner work is monitored by an internal verifier. Random sampling of learner work may take place from the examining body. Functional skills will have an external test</assessment> <learningoutcome>On the Level 1 Diploma in Creative Arts course, learners will study a range of units such as Drawing, Painting, 3D Design, Digital Photography, Multimedia and Printmaking. You will also cover personal and social development skills such as working towards goals, developing self and working as part of a group. Functional skills are also an important part of the programme and you will study English, Mathematics and IT at a level which is suitable for you as an individual</learningoutcome> <objective>The majority of the course will be either spent in art and design studios, classrooms or workshops. A lot of your time will be spent working on practical based lessons, but there will be some written work and tasks. You will be expected to work both as an individual and in teams. You will also be expected to attend theory classes in functional skills to improve your skill level</objective> <prerequisites>The course has been developed for learners who have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grades F or above. All learners will be required to attend an interview with a portfolio of work to assess their current skill level. You will also be assessed to establish which level of functional skills you should be studying</prerequisites> <regulations>No information available</regulations> <qualification> <dc:identifier>50089857</dc:identifier> <dc:title>Diploma in Vocational Studies</dc:title> <abbr>L1 DIP</abbr> <dc:description>No information available</dc:description> <educationlevel>Level 1</educationlevel> <awardedby>EDEXCEL - Pearson Education Ltd</awardedby> <accreditedby>QCF</accreditedby> </qualification> <presentation> <age>Any</age> <applyfrom dtf='2011-10-01'>1 October 2011</applyfrom> <applyto>http://www.northlindsey.ac.uk/</applyto> <applyuntil dtf='2012-07-31'>31 July 2012</applyuntil> <attendanceMode identifier='CM'>Campus</attendanceMode> <attendancePattern identifier='DT'>Daytime</attendancePattern> <mlo:cost>UK Fees: 16-18 exempt, 19+ to be advised</mlo:cost> <mlo:duration interval='P1Y'>One year</mlo:duration> <end dtf='2012-09-05'>September 2012</end> <dc:identifier>PF12001</dc:identifier> <mlo:languageOfAssessment>en</mlo:languageOfAssessment> <mlo:languageOfInstruction>en</mlo:languageOfInstruction> <dc:start dtf='2013-06-30'>June 2013</dc:start> <studyMode identifier='FT'>Full Time</studyMode> <dc:title>LEVEL 1 DIPLOMA IN ART, DESIGN & MEDIA</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.northlindsey.ac.uk/courses/PF12001</mlo:url> </presentation> </course> </provider> </catalog>

<course>

<mlo:qualification> <dc:identifier>Can be text they suggest url to permanent award info - not course</dc:identifier> <dc:title>BEng Electrical and Electronic Engineering</dc:title> <!-- Award title - CIT --> <dcterms:educationLevel>Undergraduate</dcterms:educationLevel> <!-- Course level - CIT --> <awardedBy>University of Hertfordshire</awardedBy> <!-- From CIT? --> </mlo:qualification>
<presentation> <!-- Do we present each instance of a course? --> <dc:description>A description</dc:description> <!-- CIT --> <dc:identifier>EIEE</dc:identifier> <!-- Instance code? CIT --> <dc:title>Title of the instance</dc:title> <!-- Can be inherited --> <mlo:url>http://www.herts.ac.uk/courses/Electrical-and-Electronic-Engineering.cfm</mlo:url> <!-- Same as course url at the moment --> <mlo:start>2012-05-07</mlo:start> <!-- Start date - CIT --> <end>2012-05-08</end> <!-- End date - CIT --> <mlo:duration>4 months (approx)</mlo:duration> <applyFrom>2010-03-20</applyFrom> <applyUntil>2011-01-07</applyUntil> <applyTo>http://www.herts.ac.uk</applyTo><!-- Details from online app feed --> <studyMode identifier="FT">Full time</studyMode> <attendanceMode>Self-study</attendanceMode> <attendancePattern>Part time distance education course</attendancePattern> <mlo:languageOfInstruction>EN</mlo:languageOfInstruction> <mlo:cost>UK fee: GBP155.00; Ireland fee: GBP340.00; Continental Europe fee: GBP385.00</mlo:cost> </presentation> </course>

data.value: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <catalog xmlns:dcmitype="http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/" xmlns:credit="http://purl.org/net/cm" xmlns:mlo="http://purl.org/net/mlo" xmlns:xhtml="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xsi:schemaLocation="http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog http://www.xcri.co.uk/bindings/xcri_cap_1_2.xsd http://xcri.co.uk http://www.xcri.co.uk/bindings/courseDataProgramme.xsd http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/wgs84_pos http://www.craighawker.co.uk/xcri/validation/xsds/geo.xsd" generated="2012-04-03T15:20:24.171+01:00" xmlns="http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:courseDataProgramme="http://xcri.co.uk" xmlns:geo="http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/wgs84_pos"> <dc:description>University of Sheffield test mapping. Licence: Open Government Licence (OGL), v1.0</dc:description> <provider> <dc:identifier>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:ukprn">10007157</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:ucasInstCode">S18</dc:identifier> <image src="http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/sheffield/road/Classic/article/0/shared/images/crest-xl.gif" title="University of Sheffield crest" alt="University of Sheffield crest"/> <dc:title>University of Sheffield</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/</mlo:url> <course> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:ucasCode">A100</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:internalID">504995</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/prospectus/courseDetails.do?id=5049952013</dc:identifier> <dc:subject identifier="A100">Pre-clinical medicine</dc:subject> <dc:title>Medicine</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/prospectus/courseDetails.do?id=5049952013</mlo:url> <mlo:qualification> <dc:title>MBChB in Medicine</dc:title> <abbr>MBChB</abbr> <dcterms:educationLevel>Undergraduate</dcterms:educationLevel> <awardedBy>University of Sheffield</awardedBy> </mlo:qualification> <presentation> <dc:description>Year of entry: 2013</dc:description> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:internalID">504995</dc:identifier> <mlo:prerequisite>Other qualifications: First degree - first class degree or a 2:1 + BBB at A Level<br /><a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/apply/ukquals'>Other UK qualifications</a><br /><a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/apply/international-qualifications'>Other EU/international qualifications</a>; Access to HE: <a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/mature/entryandapplication'>Entry requirements for mature students</a>; Advanced Diploma: Not accepted; Welsh Baccaleaurate + 2 A Levels: Pass + AA including Chemistry and another science subject; Scottish Highers: AAAAB + AA in Chemistry and another science; Cambridge Pre-U: D3 D3 D3 including Chemistry and another science subject; BTEC: DDD in a relevant subject with 16 units at Distinction; A Levels: AAA including Chemistry and another science subject; International Baccalaureate: 37 points, 6 in all Higher Level subjects to include Chemistry and another science subject. No less than 4 in all Standard Level subjects</mlo:prerequisite> <mlo:start dtf="2013-09-30T00:00:00">Monday 30 September 2013</mlo:start> <mlo:duration interval="P57M">57 Months</mlo:duration> <applyTo>http://www.ucas.com</applyTo> <studyMode identifier="FT">Full time</studyMode> <venue> <provider> <dc:identifier>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/</dc:identifier> <dc:title>University of Sheffield</dc:title> <mlo:location> <mlo:postcode>S10 2TN</mlo:postcode> <mlo:address>Western Bank</mlo:address> <mlo:address>Sheffield</mlo:address> <mlo:phone>0114 222 2000</mlo:phone> <mlo:email>study@sheffield.ac.uk</mlo:email> </mlo:location> </provider> </venue> </presentation> </course> <course> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:ucasCode">A104</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:internalID">522710</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/prospectus/courseDetails.do?id=5227102013</dc:identifier> <dc:title>Medicine with a Foundation Year</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/prospectus/courseDetails.do?id=5227102013</mlo:url> <mlo:qualification> <dc:title>Foundation Year in Medicine with a Foundation Year</dc:title> <abbr>Foundation Year</abbr> <dcterms:educationLevel>Undergraduate</dcterms:educationLevel> <awardedBy>University of Sheffield</awardedBy> </mlo:qualification> <presentation> <dc:description>Year of entry: 2013</dc:description> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:internalID">522710</dc:identifier> <mlo:prerequisite>Cambridge Pre-U: D3 D3 D3 in 3 non science subjects; BTEC: DDD in a relevant subject with 16 units at Distinction; Other qualifications: <a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/apply/ukquals'>Other UK qualifications</a><br /><a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/apply/international-qualifications'>Other EU/international qualifications</a>; Access to HE: <a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/mature/entryandapplication'>Entry requirements for mature students</a>; Advanced Diploma: Not accepted; Welsh Baccaleaurate + 2 A Levels: Pass + AA in 2 non science subjects; Scottish Highers + 2 Advanced Highers: AAAAB + AA; International Baccalaureate: 37 points, 6 in Higher Level non science subjects. No less than 4 in all Standard Level subjects; A Levels: AAA in three non science subjects. We expect A Levels to be taken in one sitting and are unable to accept A Level resits. A Level in General Studies is not accepted. Applicants should normally achieve ABBB at AS Level. For more details, please contact the Medical School </mlo:prerequisite> <mlo:start dtf="2013-09-30T00:00:00">Monday 30 September 2013</mlo:start> <mlo:duration interval="P69M">69 Months</mlo:duration> <applyTo>http://www.ucas.com</applyTo> <studyMode identifier="FT">Full time</studyMode> <venue> <provider> <dc:identifier>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/</dc:identifier> <dc:title>University of Sheffield</dc:title> <mlo:location> <mlo:postcode>S10 2TN</mlo:postcode> <mlo:address>Western Bank</mlo:address> <mlo:address>Sheffield</mlo:address> <mlo:phone>0114 222 2000</mlo:phone> <mlo:email>study@sheffield.ac.uk</mlo:email> </mlo:location> </provider> </venue> </presentation> </course> <course> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:ucasCode">A200</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:internalID">504978</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/prospectus/courseDetails.do?id=5049782013</dc:identifier> <dc:subject identifier="A200">Pre-clinical dentistry</dc:subject> <dc:title>Dental Surgery</dc:title> <mlo:url>http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/prospectus/courseDetails.do?id=5049782013</mlo:url> <mlo:qualification> <dc:title>BDS in Dental Surgery</dc:title> <abbr>BDS</abbr> <dcterms:educationLevel>Undergraduate</dcterms:educationLevel> <awardedBy>University of Sheffield</awardedBy> </mlo:qualification> <presentation> <dc:description>Year of entry: 2013</dc:description> <dc:identifier xsi:type="courseDataProgramme:internalID">504978</dc:identifier> <mlo:prerequisite>Other qualifications: <a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/apply/ukquals'>Other UK qualifications</a><br /><a href='http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/undergraduate/apply/international-qualifications'>Other EU/international qualifications</a>;
